instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the improvement in the assessment of iron content in soil, and how far can this metric go in assessing iron content in soil?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the improvement in iron prediction is the RPD (Residual Prediction Deviation). The RPD value increased from 1.57 to 2.31 after implementing the suggested method of heating the sample to remove organic matter content. 

The RPD is a measure of the ratio between the standard deviation of the reference values and the root mean square error (RMSE) of prediction. It provides an indication of the reliability and accuracy of the prediction model. 

In terms of assessing iron content in soil, the RPD value of 2.31 suggests a moderate improvement in the prediction model.
